intro: Aptandropsis discophora, commonly known as the broad-leafed aptandropsis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
